speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the episode of loss of consciousness you experienced? Was it sudden or did you have any warning signs beforehand?

speaker: Patient
text: "It happened suddenly, I remember standing up from the toilet, and then...I don't know, it was like I just fell. I didn't feel any pain, just a kind of...blankness, I guess."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the circumstances surrounding the episode, such as what you were doing and where you were when it happened?

speaker: Patient
text: "I was in the bathroom, just standing up from the toilet, like I said. I hadn't finished yet, I was in the middle of...you know, taking care of business. It was a pretty normal situation, nothing out of the ordinary."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you walk me through what happened immediately before the episode, such as if you were standing up, sitting down, or performing any physical activity that could have contributed to your loss of consciousness?

speaker: Patient
text: "Well, I had just stood up from the toilet, as I mentioned, and I was...ah...taking care of business. I didn't feel like I was in any kind of hurry or exerting myself in any way, it was just a normal action. I didn't even think about it, it was just something I did without a second thought."

text: "I'd say my job as a high school teacher puts me on my feet a lot throughout the day, but it's not typically strenuous work. I'm not sure if it's a contributing factor to the episode of loss of consciousness, but I do try to take care of myself and manage my workload."
